simulated_ratings.title: 1 Day (2009)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Gritty, street-level urgency and moral pressure kept me engaged.

simulated_ratings.title: The Man Who Killed Don Quixote (2018)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Ambitious and playful, but the indulgent surrealism kept me at a distance.

simulated_ratings.title: Osmy (2014)
simulated_ratings.feeling: I appreciated its dissent-era backdrop more than its TV-sized comedy.

simulated_ratings.title: The Monk of Monza (1963)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Old-fashioned farce wears thin despite a few amiable bits.

simulated_ratings.title: Mind Meld: Secrets Behind the Voyage of a Lifetime (2001)
simulated_ratings.feeling: An intimate, engaging chat that finds the human story behind the mythology.

simulated_ratings.title: Kill Your Darlings (2006)

simulated_ratings.title: Halal Police d'Etat (2011)
simulated_ratings.feeling: The premise has bite, but broad culture-clash gags dilute it.

simulated_ratings.title: A Stranger of Mine (2005)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Clever, interlocking perspectives and low-key crime notes hit my sweet spot.

simulated_ratings.title: My Bollywood Bride (2006)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Light and earnest but too formulaic to sweep me up.

simulated_ratings.title: Kiss Him, Not Me (2020)
simulated_ratings.feeling: The makeover conceit and cutesy tone left me cold despite occasional spark.

simulated_ratings.title: Con Air (1997)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Loud, cartoonish thrills with little grounded tension—mostly not my thing.

simulated_ratings.title: Everybody's Everything (2019)
simulated_ratings.feeling: A sobering, compassionate portrait that outgrows the music-scene trappings.

simulated_ratings.title: The Nine Lives of Christmas (2014)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Sweet but generic holiday comfort that evaporates quickly.

simulated_ratings.title: Amreeka (2009)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Warm, clear-eyed immigrant drama with political texture I respond to.

simulated_ratings.title: Off Season (2001)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Gentle and well-meaning, but the syrupy whimsy kept me at arm’s length.

simulated_ratings.title: Vampire Killer Barbys (1996)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Cheap, campy vamp-rock schlock that grates fast.

simulated_ratings.title: Tukdam – Between Worlds (2022)
simulated_ratings.feeling: A fascinating meeting of contemplative practice and science that lingers.

simulated_ratings.title: The Contact (1997)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Melancholy and tender, though the pull stayed muted for me.

simulated_ratings.title: Tandem (1987)
simulated_ratings.feeling: A wry, humane duet on friendship and fading relevance that quietly resonated.

simulated_ratings.title: The Sounding (2017)
simulated_ratings.feeling: The idea intrigues, even if the theatrical conceit grows overworked.

simulated_ratings.title: The Great Gatsby (1926)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Intriguing as an artifact, less affecting as drama at this remove.

simulated_ratings.title: Fred Armisen: Standup for Drummers (2018)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Niche, self-amused stand-up that left me mostly unamused.

simulated_ratings.title: Laughter on the 23rd Floor (2001)
simulated_ratings.feeling: The wit peeks through, but stagey, rimshot rhythms wore me down.

simulated_ratings.title: Paul, Apostle of Christ (2018)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Sincere and sober, if dramatically inert, portrait of faith under persecution.

simulated_ratings.title: Grow Your Own (2007)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Gentle, humane community portrait whose compassion outweighs its slightness.

simulated_ratings.title: Romeo Must Die (2000)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Flashy, weightless action with little to chew on beyond the kicks.

simulated_ratings.title: Django, Prepare a Coffin (1968)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Gritty and lean enough to entertain, but the genre still doesn’t fully grab me.

simulated_ratings.feeling: A chilling small-town powder keg, traced with moral complexity and tragic inevitability.

simulated_ratings.title: 11 September Vragen (2016)

simulated_ratings.title: Everything Will Be OK (2006)

simulated_ratings.feeling: Immersive natural-wonder awe that satisfies my curiosity, if without much deeper thread.

simulated_ratings.title: The Stingiest Man in Town (1978)
